sentences.en: "I would like you to return to the villa as soon as possible," she said without preamble.
sentences.cn: 她开门见山地说：“我想让你尽快回到别墅。”

sentences.en: All of the code book may be specified in the preamble website.
sentences.cn: 本书全部程序代码可由前言中指定网站下载.

sentences.en: Harding gave him the news without preamble (= without saying anything else before it ) .
sentences.cn: 哈丁开门见山把消息告诉了他。

sentences.en: He launched into his statement without any preamble.
sentences.cn: 他开门见山地发表言论.

sentences.en: In outline , it falls into four parts : preamble, theoretical introduction , substantial contents and conclusion.
sentences.cn: 全文在结构上由引言 、 导论 、 分论和结语四大部分构成.

sentences.en: Mr Verba's gentle preamble through leather - bound tradition was leading to something momentous.
sentences.cn: 维巴先生就哈佛藏书所作的温文尔雅的开场白,将拉开重大事件的帷幕.

sentences.en: Professor Wang Xuan says so without preamble to this print journalist.
sentences.cn: 王选教授对本刊记者开门见山如是说.

sentences.en: The aims of the treaty are stated in its preamble.
sentences.cn: 条约的宗旨已在序言中说明。

sentences.en: The controversy has arisen over the text of the preamble to the unification treaty.
sentences.cn: 针对统一条约的序文出现了争论。

sentences.en: The preamble introduces research condition about an epic and the epic.
sentences.cn: 序言主要涉及了有关史诗的研究动态.

sentences.en: The reasons for a law are often atated in a preamble.
sentences.cn: 一项法律的创制理由常常都会陈述在序言中.

sentences.en: Thereupon this phrase in the preamble was depleted.
sentences.cn: 因此,前言中的这一句话就被删去了.

sentences.en: This extraordinary preamble to the worker's demands was received differently in four different quarters.
sentences.cn: 这篇铿锵的应工人要求的檄文在四个居住区引起了不同反响.

sentences.en: This thesis arranges for the content as follows: Preamble.
sentences.cn: 本文对人本管理研究的内容安排如下: 序言.

sentences.en: This thesis consists of the preamble, the text and conclusion.
sentences.cn: 本文由绪论 、 正文、结语三大部分组成.

sentences.en: Truth needs not many words; but a false tales a long preamble.
sentences.cn: 真理不须多言; 谎言累牍连篇.

phrases.tran_cn: 直截了当地，开门见山地，单刀直入地

trans.tran_cn: 序，绪言，（法令、文件等的）序文，前言
trans.tran_en: a statement at the beginning of a book, document, or talk, explaining what it is about
